thread.title: UPDATE: 1 killed in overnight City Market shooting
thread.title_full: UPDATE: 1 killed in overnight City Market shooting | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: UPDATE: 1 killed in overnight City Market shooting
text:
By Savannah Morning News Savannah-Chatham metro police's violent crime detectives have made an arrest in a shooting which occurred in City Market on West Congress Street at approximately 2:20 a.m. Sunday.
Joseph Heyward, 23, of Savannah, was arrested and charged with the shooting of Frank Wilson, 24, also of Savannah, said Michelle Gavin, spokeswoman for the Savannah-Chatham Metro Police Department. Heyward admitted to investigators that he targeted the Wilson specifically.
Gavin said the shooting appears to be a retaliatory act due to previous violence between the shooter's family and the victim's family.
Wilson was transported to the hospital in critical condition. He later succumbed to his injuries. The situation is now being investigated as a homicide, Gavin said.
Several witnesses remained in the area after the shooting and provided valuable information to investigators, Gavin said. The investigation is ongoing.
